Articles.Content: Question: how do you guys prepare those huge static radiators for launch? I love the way they look, but they seem *extremely* unwieldy when it comes to actually getting them deployed into orbit. In reality they would probably be assembled from parts once in space, but unfortunately KSP's options for that are very limited.

Am I doing something wrong here? The GR-EXP 50W core radiator on the MX-EXP generator doesn't seem to be doing much of anything (17% cooling?), so the core temp just keeps climbing.  
![sSbby4M.png](http://i.imgur.com/sSbby4M.png)

> 
> 
> 15 hours ago, Rodger said:
> 
> 
> Am I doing something wrong here? The GR-EXP 50W core radiator on the MX-EXP generator doesn't seem to be doing much of anything (17% cooling?), so the core temp just keeps climbing.
> 

That's not nearly enough cooling. The MX-EXP needs 200 kW of heat rejection (check the <abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building">VAB</abbr> module info), you're providing a total of 50 kW per reactor, plus whatever other cooling you're getting from the big radiators. With 3 reactors you will need 600 kW of cooling power

Ok cool, I just only saw 50kW mentioned as required cooling in the <abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building">VAB</abbr>, 200kW isn't mentioned at all:  
![s0qKMZh.png](http://i.imgur.com/s0qKMZh.png)

Ah I had forgotten that we tuned it way down. Waaaay down. 

I had a quick test with just the reactor and the radiator and it worked fine (that cooling % number is useless, you can ignore it). I can't tell offhand what's wrong, but you might want to check your total radiator capacity vs your total core heat needs. I see at least 4 drills on your craft which create some amount of heat, and i guess you might have some ISRUs running. It's possible that they are being cooled by the reactor radiators.
Moar radiators! Seriously, heat is often under-estimated, especially with drills and <abbr title="In-Situ Resource Utilization">ISRU</abbr> added.
